definition: 1. A character in Dickens's novel "Barnaby Rudge," a beautiful, lively, and coquettish girl who wore a cherry-colored mantle and cherry-colored ribbons. 2. A style of light, bright-figured dress goods for women; also, a style of dress. Dolly Varden trout (Zo√∂l.), a trout of northwest America; -- called also bull trout, malma, and red-spotted trout. See Malma.
